thread.title: Roswell's Frances McGahee Youth Day Celebration is Saturday
thread.title_full: Roswell's Frances McGahee Youth Day Celebration is Saturday | www.ajc.com

author: Carolyn Cunningham
title: Roswell's Frances McGahee Youth Day Celebration is Saturday
text:
You’ve got a few hours over the weekend and are looking for a nearby diversion - something that doesn’t require reservations or a tank of gas. Welcome to Close to Home! Each week we’ll highlight the quick, quaint and quirky events in your neighborhood. Email submissions to CommunityNews@ajc.com.
Sweet Repeats sale in Hampton
Sweet Repeats children’s consignment sale to raise funds for local AWANA programs for children, 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. today (with many items half price today), Atlanta Motor Speedway, 1500 Tara Place, Hampton. www.SweetRepeats.org.
Community Yard Sale in Decatur
Roswell’s Frances McGahee Youth Day Celebration will be held today with a 9:45 a.m. Historic Roswell 5K Road Race from Roswell United Methodist Church, 814 Mimosa Blvd. to the Roswell Area Park football field, 10495 Woodstock Road; a 10 a.m. parade from the First Baptist Church of Roswell, 710 Mimosa Blvd. to Roswell Area Park with grand marshals being members of the Lacrosse State Championship teams from Roswell and Centennial High Schools and a Youth Day Festival after the parade, Roswell Area Park with free lunch for ages 15 and under (while supplies last), inflatable slides, moonwalks, pony rides, a climbing wall and entertainment. RoswellGov.com, 770-641-3705. Contributed by City of Roswell Community Yard Sale, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. today, Valley Brook Baptist Church, 1198 North Valley Brook Road, Decatur. vbbchurch.com, 404-292-0212.
Fall Walk in Duluth
Fall Walk at McDaniel Farm, 10:30 a.m. to noon today and Oct. 24, 3251 McDaniel Road, Duluth. $8. GwinnettEHC.org/event-registration-2/?ee=1374.
Public Safety Appreciation in Dallas
Paulding Public Safety Appreciation Day, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. today, Veteran’s Park in front of the Watson Government Complex (new Paulding County Courthouse), 240 Constitution Blvd., Dallas with free child fingerprinting, free vision exams, a prescription drug take-back box, food vendors and free giveaways. Fundraising by the nonprofit Paulding Public Safety Appreciation, Inc. helps provide financial assistance to the county’s protectors and their families during their times of need. Free. ashley.henson@paulding.gov, 770-505-5535.
Trunk or Treat in Kennesaw
Fall Festival and Trunk or Treat, 3 to 6 p.m. today, Living Hope Church, 3450 Stilesboro Road, Kennesaw. Free. Dress in costume, trick or treat through a maze of decorated vehicles, play games, win prizes, feast on popcorn and apple cider and get glitter tattoos. The silent auction will benefit the church’s school. joy@livinghopega.com, 770-425-6726, LivingHopeGa.com.
Atlanta Master Chorale at Emory
Atlanta Master Chorale season premiere presents “Come, Stay, Go!”, 8 p.m. today, Emory University’s Schwartz Center for Performing Arts, 1700 North Decatur Road. $10 to $20. Arts at Emory Box Office, 404-727-5050.
Boxerstock Music Festival in Marietta
Boxerstock Music Festival to benefit Atlanta Boxer Rescue, noon to 6 p.m. Sunday, Jim R. Miller Park, 2245 Callaway Road, Marietta with live music and an abundance of activities, welcoming well-behaved dogs of all breeds. $5 to $10. AtlantaBoxerRescue.org, boxerstock.org.
Jazz pianist Joe Alterman in Dunwoody
Jazz at the JCC Presents Joe Alterman, pianist and composer, 5 p.m. and 7 p.m. Sunday, the Marcus Jewish Community Center of Atlanta’s Morris and Rae Frank Theatre, Zaban-Blank Building, 5342 Tilly Mill Road, Dunwoody for all ages. JoeAltermanMusic.com. $17 to $22. Tickets: ShowClix.com/events/15056, 678-812-4002.
‘Hope Shines’ ceremony in Roswell
“Hope Shines” by She Is Safe, a prayer and light ceremony about the plight of girls around the globe and celebrating their potential by shining a candle or flashlight into the sky, 6 to 7:15 p.m. Sunday, Memorial Gardens, Roswell City Hall, 38 Hill St. SheIsSafe.org, 877-552-1402.
